s.text: Colorado, supported by 18 other states and the Clinton administration, says that at 8 feet one can speak in a normal tone of voice and be clearly heard, and thus the law does nothing to curb "uninhibited debate on all topics."
Cruel, dim, and out of touch with American life-no, not the evil bastards who killed Charles Schulz-the U. S. Supreme Court, at least that's how they look to quiz participants.
It merely allows a woman to go to the doctor without someone screaming in her face.
